etymologies: Middle English: perhaps from Middle Dutch spotte. The sense ‘notice, recognize’ arose from the early 19th century slang use ‘note as a suspect or criminal’

definitions: a small round or roundish mark, differing in color or texture from the surface around it

examples.text: ladybugs have black spots on their red wing covers

shortDefinitions: small round or roundish mark, differing in colour or texture from surface around it

definitions: a small mark or stain

examples.text: a spot of mildew on the wall

shortDefinitions: small mark or stain

definitions: a pimple.
shortDefinitions: pimple

definitions: a moral blemish or stain.
shortDefinitions: blemish on someone's character or reputation

definitions: a pip on a domino, playing card, or die.
shortDefinitions: pip on domino, playing card, or dice

definitions: a particular place or point

examples.text: a nice secluded spot
an ideal picnic spot

shortDefinitions: particular place or point

definitions: a small feature or part of something with a particular quality

examples.text: his bald spot
there was one bright spot in a night of dismal failure

shortDefinitions: small feature or part of something with particular quality

definitions: (in sports) an advantage allowed to a player as a handicap.
a position within a listing; a ranking

examples.text: the runner-up spot

shortDefinitions: ranking

definitions: a place for an individual item within a show

examples.text: she couldn't do her usual singing spot in the club

shortDefinitions: place for individual item within show

definitions: a small amount of something

examples.text: a spot of rain

shortDefinitions: small amount of something

definitions: denoting a system of trading in which commodities or currencies are delivered and paid for immediately after a sale

examples.text: trading in the spot markets
the current spot price

shortDefinitions: denoting system of trading in which commodities or currencies are delivered and paid for immediately after sale

definitions: a banknote of a specified value

examples.text: a ten-spot

shortDefinitions: banknote of specified value

definitions: a bar or other drinking establishment (usually in a private home in a township) that operates without an official permit

examples.text: her father was at the spot with his friends

shortDefinitions: bar that operates without official permit

definitions: see, notice, or recognize (someone or something) that is difficult to detect or that one is searching for

examples.text: Andrew spotted the ad in the paper
the men were spotted by police

shortDefinitions: see, notice, or recognize person or thing that is difficult to detect or that one is searching for

definitions: recognize that (someone) has a particular talent, especially for sports or show business

examples.text: we were spotted by a talent scout

shortDefinitions: recognize that someone has particular talent

definitions: locate an enemy's position, typically from the air

examples.text: they were spotting for enemy aircraft

shortDefinitions: locate enemy's position

definitions: (in weight training, gymnastics, etc.) observe (a performer) in order to minimize the risk of accidents or injuries.
shortDefinitions: (in weight training, gymnastics, etc.) observe

definitions: mark with spots

examples.text: the velvet was spotted with stains

shortDefinitions: mark or become marked with spots

definitions: become marked with spots

examples.text: a damp atmosphere causes the flowers to spot

shortDefinitions: become marked with spots

definitions: cover (a surface or area) thinly

examples.text: thorn trees spotted the land

shortDefinitions: cover surface or area thinly

definitions: stain or sully the moral character or qualities of

examples.text: they might be spotted merely with the errors introduced by Luther

shortDefinitions: stain or sully moral character or qualities of

definitions: place (a billiard ball or football) on its designated starting point.
shortDefinitions: place ball on its designated starting point on billiard table

definitions: give or lend (money) to (someone)

examples.text: I'll spot you $300

shortDefinitions: give or lend money to

definitions: allow (an advantage) to (someone) in a game or sport

examples.text: the higher-rated team spots the lower-rated team the difference in their handicaps

shortDefinitions: allow advantage to someone in game or sport
